title: Retro Arcade Time Loop Adventure #9
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Neon Arcade Floor
rooms.description: A dimly lit arcade filled with the glow of CRT screens and the electronic beeps of classic games. Rows of vintage arcade cabinets line the walls. The carpet is worn with geometric patterns. A strange feeling of déjà vu washes over you. A door marked EMPLOYEES ONLY stands to the north.

items.name: PACMAN arcade cabinet
items.description: A classic yellow cabinet with joystick controls. The high score screen flickers.
items.text: HIGH SCORE: 999,999 by ACE. A note taped to the side reads: 'Remember the champions: ACE scored 999, BLAZE got 450, and NOVA reached 128.'

items.name: Space Invaders cabinet
items.description: A black cabinet with alien graphics and a fire button worn smooth from use.

items.name: arcade token
items.description: A shiny token with 'PIXEL PALACE ARCADE' stamped on it

items.name: Donkey Kong cabinet
items.description: A red cabinet showing a gorilla throwing barrels. The screen displays a looping demo.

items.name: arcade maintenance manual
items.description: A worn manual with handwritten notes in the margins
items.text: PIXEL PALACE ARCADE - Owner: Manager Rick Stevens. Emergency procedures: In case of temporal anomaly, access the Loop Control System in the back room. Only the manager has authorization.

items.name: prize counter
items.description: A glass counter displaying cheap toys and candy. The register drawer is slightly open.

items.name: flathead screwdriver
items.description: A tool left behind by a maintenance worker

items.name: manager's office door
items.description: A wooden door with a sign reading MANAGER - RICK STEVENS. The lock mechanism looks old.

rooms.name: Manager's Office
rooms.description: A cluttered office with posters of classic arcade games covering the walls. A desk is buried under papers and empty energy drink cans. A filing cabinet stands in the corner. Through a window, you can see the arcade floor, but something seems off about the lighting. A reinforced door to the east has a keypad lock.

items.name: manager's desk
items.description: A metal desk covered in invoices and repair receipts

items.name: manager's personal journal
items.description: A notebook with daily entries about the arcade
items.text: Day 47: The loop continues. Every night at closing, time resets. I've hidden the access card in the filing cabinet. The combination is the high scores in order: ACE, BLAZE, NOVA. The back room holds the answer. I must remember: I am Rick Stevens, this arcade opened in 1982, and the loop must be broken.

items.name: metal filing cabinet
items.description: A four drawer cabinet with labels barely visible under dust

items.name: tax forms
items.description: Boring financial paperwork from 1982
items.text: PIXEL PALACE ARCADE - Established 1982. Owner: Rick Stevens.

items.name: temporal anomaly report
items.description: A scientific document with complex diagrams
items.text: CLASSIFIED: Temporal loop detected at coordinates matching arcade location. Loop initiated by experimental arcade cabinet in back room. Reset occurs at 2400 hours daily. Recommend immediate shutdown of Loop Control System.

items.name: security access card
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY

items.name: framed arcade posters
items.description: Vintage posters from the golden age of arcades
items.text: Posters for: Galaga, Centipede, Defender, and more. A handwritten note says: 'The back room cabinet was delivered in 1982, the year we opened.'

items.name: reinforced metal door
items.description: A heavy security door with a digital keypad. A warning label reads: AUTHORIZED ACCESS ONLY - TEMPORAL EQUIPMENT.

password_questions.question: What is the manager's full name?
password_questions.hint: Check the door sign and the manager's journal

password_questions.question: What year did the arcade open?
password_questions.hint: Look at the tax documents and the journal entries

password_questions.question: What must be broken?
password_questions.hint: The manager's journal mentions what needs to be broken

rooms.name: Temporal Control Room
rooms.description: You've found it! A secret room containing a bizarre arcade cabinet that pulses with unnatural energy. Wires and cables connect it to banks of computers and monitoring equipment. The cabinet's screen shows a countdown timer that keeps resetting to 24:00:00. A large lever labeled LOOP RESET is mounted on the wall. Reality seems to shimmer and distort around the cabinet.

items.name: experimental arcade cabinet
items.description: A strange cabinet covered in warning labels and blinking lights. The screen displays: TIME LOOP ACTIVE - CYCLE 2,847.
items.text: WARNING: Experimental temporal arcade game. Do not operate without authorization. To deactivate loop, pull emergency reset lever.

items.name: computer monitoring station
items.description: Banks of computers showing temporal readings and loop statistics
items.text: LOOP STATUS: ACTIVE. Duration: 2,847 cycles. Anomaly source: Experimental cabinet. Solution: Manual override via emergency lever.

items.name: loop reset lever
items.description: A large red lever with a sign: EMERGENCY LOOP TERMINATION. Pull to break temporal cycle and restore normal time flow.

rooms.name: Arcade at Dawn
rooms.description: The temporal distortion fades away like a bad dream. The arcade cabinet powers down with a final electronic whine. Through the windows, you see the sun rising for the first time in what feels like years. The clock on the wall ticks forward normally. Time is flowing again. You're free!

items.name: morning sunlight
items.description: Beautiful golden light streaming through the windows, proof that time is moving forward again

items.name: wall clock
items.description: A clock that finally shows time progressing normally instead of resetting

rooms.win_message: You've broken the time loop! The experimental arcade cabinet is permanently disabled, and the Pixel Palace Arcade is free from its temporal prison. Manager Rick Stevens can finally go home after being trapped for 2,847 cycles. The sun rises on a new day, and time flows forward once more. You win!
